attributes.action: stop ALL benefit cuts.
attributes.background:
the government is again planning to cut benefits... across the board. this is wrong. these benefits are needed to survive. too many are being forced to use food banks.
the government is pushing thousands into poverty. and most are already there. vote to stop this.  take action.

attributes.action: Implement a Fibroids Education Awareness and Screening Program
attributes.background: NHS statistics state 1 in 3 women from menstrual to menopausal age may have fibroids, which are non-cancerous growths in the womb. Women become aware of fibroids when experiencing extreme pain, heavy bleeding, infertility etc. A high oestrogen diet could contribute to fibroid growth.
attributes.additional_details:
References 
Fibroids - http://www.nhs.uk/Conditions/Fibroids/Pages/Introduction.aspx

Fibroids symptoms and diet - http://www.smartnutrition.co.uk/conditions/female-health/fibroids/

attributes.action: Create a framework for PSHE in KS4
attributes.background: Presently, PSHE is a compulsory but non-statutory subject, meaning that although  it has to be taught, it is fully flexible with the content of which is taught. Having now left school, and be in an environment that is completely different I feel very unprepared for a variety of situations.
attributes.additional_details: The Governments guidance to delivering PSHE instructs teachers to tailor lessons to 'suit the needs of pupils', which seems to ignore the diversity of students and that once they have left school they may face different types of problems. The diversity of sexual orientations in sexual education is often ignored, what to do in an area with high crime rates, how to get a loan or mortgage or how to be a parent should you become a young parent. These are just a few things that need to be improved.

attributes.action: Tax "junk foods", & give the money to Companies who produce healthy products.
attributes.background: What we eat has a detrimental affect on our physical and mental health & the wrong decisions are costing the NHS money. People need incentive to eat a balanced diet & the price difference isn't helping.
attributes.additional_details:
BBC news reported that Poor diet 'costs NHS £6bn a year'
Jamie oliver saw an increase in grades and a reduction "authorised absences" — which are generally due to illness – fell by 15% after his 2004 Feed Me Better campaign,
Researchers describe one survey which found that 39% of people rated price as the most important factor in their food choice compared to just 9% who considered a food’s healthiness to be most important. Thursday October 9 2014, NHS choices.

attributes.action: Review Child Tax Credits to stop people being overpaid.
attributes.background: Many parents have received the "dreaded" letter from the child tax credit office telling us that we have (unknowingly) been overpaid child tax credits and now face having to pay back a huge amount of money or will be taken to court. This is due to a very complicated application and benefits system.
attributes.additional_details: Figures are based on estimated earnings and estimated child care costs for the year. Forms do not ask the right questions with regards to other schemes and benefits misleading parents and allowing them to be claiming for other benefits which they do not realise they are not entitled to. A number of complicated forms are sent out to "check" details throughout the year very often with wrong information on. Errors are amended by lengthy phone calls to the credit office, but still we get it wrong!

attributes.action: Save Stoke-on-Trent train station to keep it where it is!
attributes.background: The transport department want to move Stoke-on-Trent train station to Etruria, this means we loose our beautiful historic building with its period features forever in exchange for an ugly modern purpose built building. This cannot happen!
attributes.additional_details: http://m.stokesentinel.co.uk/8203-Stoke-station-relocate-multi-million-pound/story-28736564-detail/story.html

attributes.action: Call for EU sanctions against Denmark until whaling is stopped in Faroe Islands
attributes.background: The Faeroe islands kill hundreds of whales and dolphins every year. The rest of the world, apart from Japan, have put whaling behind them. The Danish government are allowing whaling to continue and even supporting it through military action. The pointless murder of whale and dolphins must be stopped
attributes.additional_details:
Check out the UK Government IWC document from 2008
Check out Sea Shepherd conservation society

attributes.action: UK Government to press the government of Iraq to grant Kurdistan's independence.
attributes.background: Kurdistan has been divided into 4 different countries, which are in Iraq, Turkey, Syria and iran. Kurds are a large ethnic group with a population of 35 million and without their own nation. We kurds deserve our own nation and independence , we have our own language, gov', culture, national flag.etc
attributes.additional_details:
-Kurds are currently defending their borders against ISIS with not so modern and limited weapons. 
-The kurds have regained all its territory back from ISIS. 
-ISIS struggle when in battle against the kurds

attributes.action: Put Pressure on the Airlines to Lower Ticket Prices due to Lower Fuel prices.
attributes.background: With the Large drop in Prices at the Pumps Airlines have Not Followed with Reductions in Ticket Prices, so they must be making Very large Profits from their Passengers which is wrong, should be an Equal Playing Field.
attributes.additional_details:
Air Travel have Not come down although Fuel have by a Large amount, this is Ripping Off their Customers.

Let's get the Government to put pressure on Airlines to bring their prices down by way of Cheaper Fares.

attributes.action: Make it easier for small and medium-sized businesses to supply government.
attributes.background: I own a small business and am encouraged to hear government talk of making things easier for small & medium-sized businesses (SMEs) to supply government yet find no evidence this is happening.
attributes.additional_details:
When I see tender documents running into several hundred pages I seriously doubt a drive from government to widen up the supply chain to SMEs as the resources are simply not available.

Add to this the increasing burden of health & safety legislation, compulsory employment surveys, automatic enrolment pensions, four annual tax returns etc etc and we are drowning in a sea of petty admin, struggling to focus on running our business.

attributes.action: A full enquiry into G4S management of all youth and custody services.
attributes.background: Following Panorama documentary that detailed the abuse and torture of our most vulnerable kids, a full enquiry is needed into how abusive culture is being allowed to exist within G4S Medway and justice for kids being abused there.  A fully investigation into the management of all G4S services.

attributes.action: BRCA - Provide a consistent approach to advice, care and support across the UK
attributes.background: There is an inconsistent approach to advice, care and support given to BRCA women and men across the UK. Women and men are being diagnosed with cancer every day when it could have been prevented. Let's make this change.
attributes.additional_details:
A questionnaire is currently underway to collate the inconsistencies from the health care. But some examples so far are;
1. Surveillance options for breast and Ovarian Cancer varies (available in some areas)
2. Assigned geneticists 
3. Inconsistent advice for BSO  
4. Availability of PGD / IVF 
5. Waiting times to see the breast surgeons
6. Availability of testing 

These are some. I am BRCA1 positive, Ambassador for BRCA Umbrella and Voice for OCA. I see it every day and it needs changing.

attributes.action: Give England its own National Anthem
attributes.background:
Wales, Scotland, and Ireland have their own National Anthems.  In fact, all our neighbours do, but not us, not England.  
During England's football match, the Welsh were able to sing their proud and stirring Welsh National Anthem, but they also sang ours, because it belongs to the UK, not England.
attributes.additional_details:
A National Anthem is about identity, which is particularly important during major sporting fixtures, as well as any public fixtures and competitions between the countries of the United Kingdom.

England is too often left behind, and it is surely time, that in common with her neighbours, she has a National Anthem which is her own.  I want to petition Parliament to consider my proposal, and I suggest 'Land of Hope and Glory' as something everyone can get behind.

Please consider supporting this.

attributes.action: School Summer holiday to be reduced and Easter holiday increased
attributes.background: Reduce 6-7 week holiday and increase Easter break, to allow more family's to take a holiday to hot continents, or visit relatives
attributes.additional_details: If summer holiday is reduced and Easter increased then an option to take a descent holiday is increased twice a year to travel to hot continents and less  absences during school time

attributes.action: Introduce a jury system so family's fighting forced adoption have a fair trial
attributes.background: Fighting social services on forced adoption, give families a fair say and the options to explore every solution on earth to make changes to keep families together.
attributes.additional_details: Adoption is so final and social services play God with children's lives forced adoption is barbaric

attributes.action: Change the gambling age to 21+ now!
attributes.background: With more and more gambling sites appearing, new bookies opening daily, and the sponsorships of Gambling companies appearing all over, and around our sport teams stadiums and merchandise. Our younger generation is constantly force fed and reminded of these companies.
attributes.additional_details: With a National Lottery ticket you must be 16+, Any bookies and/or Casino 18+, I feel if we postpone the ability to gamble, this will have massive benefits to the younger generation as they'll have a much better understanding of money and it's worth at the age of 21, as opposed to 16/18. Let's take control of early addiction, and encourage our own self-success.

attributes.action: Article 50 to not be invoked until mandated by a special general election
attributes.background: Article 50 can only be invoked after passing through Parliament. This proposal allows the electorate to accept or reject the outcome of 'informal' negotiations with the EU through Parliamentary Democracy. All candidates voting intentions to be shown on the ballot paper - EXIT, REMAIN or UNDECLARED
attributes.additional_details: Following the close referendum result the consequences of the outcome have been more clearly understood by the electorate, deep divisions are evident in many areas. This proposal is designed to rebuild unity by making Parliament only accept the proposed 'informal' negotiated terms if so mandated by the electorate. As the voting intentions of each candidate are shown on the ballot paper, the result will either finally confirm the 'exit' referendum result or supersede it.

attributes.action: Reinstate A&E, renovate, modernise and expand High Wycombe General Hospital.
attributes.background: High Wycombe is a busy market town and hub for London commuters. As a newer college town its growing population has increased medical needs. Its Accident and Emergency Services were relocated to Stoke Mandeville, Bucks, which is 15.7m away (27 mins via the A413), or 13.2m (26 mins via Hampden Rd).
attributes.additional_details: Lives are jeopardised by transit times along country roads which are unsuitable for the task and make overtaking ambulances a traffic hazard. There is inadequate infrastructure to service the population, and that of neighbouring towns for whom Wycombe provided a closer A&E option. This petition calls upon the NHS, Wycombe District Council and Wycombe MP Steve Baker to renovate, modernise and expand the General Hospital in Wycombe, and reinstate Wycombe A&E as a flagship for the NHS in Bucks.

attributes.action: Hold a vote to find out if the country wants a second EU referendum
attributes.background: The Leave campaign has distanced itself from their pre-referendum statements, has no post referendum plan and many people who voted out have changed their mind. We, the undersigned feel that this would be the only democratic route to gauge opinion and offer a way to unite the country once again.

attributes.action: Hold 2nd EU referendum, allowing 16 & 17 year olds in Scotland to vote.
attributes.background: The Scottish referendum and EU referendum are linked. 16 & 17 yr olds were allowed to vote in the Scottish referendum. Scotland's position as part of the UK is now uncertain based on the Brexit result. Today's 16 & 17 year olds should be given the same rights to defend their future as in 2014.
attributes.additional_details:
http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/uk-politics-36616028

2nd Scottish independence referendum likely: http://www.theguardian.com/politics/2016/jun/24/alex-salmond-second-scottish-independence-referendum-is-certain

http://indy100.independent.co.uk/article/how-old-people-have-screwed-over-the-younger-generationin-three-charts--W1AA_n4nEb

http://www.telegraph.co.uk/news/2016/06/26/scottish-independence-has-nearly-60-per-cent-support-poll-finds/

attributes.action: Call for an early election with support for proportional representation.
attributes.background: At a time where the country is in need of leadership, our representation has failed a public of diverse views. Reform is urgently needed to support a liberal democracy, with proportional representation; where ministers are elected based on their qualifications to represent a sector; all views count.
attributes.additional_details:
The lead up to the EU Referendum in the UK has exposed our leaders as being at odds with the public they are meant to serve. A vote of no confidence is required, not just in the party leaders and our Prime Minister, but also in the way the public are represented, and the way in which decisions are made on public services.

We, the undersigned, call for an early election - within the year; with reform for proportional representation and the right to elect ministers based on their qualifications.

attributes.action: All pledges in democratic elections and referendums should be legally binding.
attributes.background: The recent EU referendum result is based upon a campaign of misinformation.  This is not democratic since the public are not being told the truth. All elections pledges should be clear and legally binding. Any politician found to be deliberately misleading the public should be convicted of fraud.

attributes.action: Make it mandatory to display a halal food sign in businesses serving halal food.
attributes.background: All businesses serving halal food should clearly display a sign at the entrance of their establishment stating that the food they serve is halal. This would allow people of the Muslim faith to clearly identify where they are permitted to eat and Sikhs to identify where they cannot eat.

attributes.action: Make future UK referendum results require a majority of 60%
attributes.background: Referendums are called by the UK government on matters of major constitutional change. Any major change from the status quo should have the backing of at least 60% of those who vote in each referendum.
attributes.additional_details: Recent referendums have demonstrated the strongly devisive nature of proposed major changes to people's lives, especially when the result is close to an even split. Having to reach a qualified majority of 60% in any UK referendum would help ensure that changes are more widely accepted amongst the electorate.

attributes.action: Offer British citizenship to Polish nationals resident in the UK on June 23 2016
attributes.background: The Polish people are longstanding & valued friends and allies of the UK, and we have deep ties which exceed and excel any EU links. We hereby petition the UK Government to extend an offer of automatic British Citizenship to all Polish nationals resident in the UK on June 23rd 2016.
attributes.additional_details:
We deeply regret the sense of insult felt by the Polish nation resulting from the referendum decision to leave the EU. We wish to repair our relationship. We wish to recognise the outstanding contribution to peace of the Free Polish Army, and to reassure the UK's widespread, well integrated, Polish-heritage communities, which in many cases pre-date the formation of the EU. 

http://www.bbc.co.uk/history/familyhistory/bloodlines/migration.shtml?entry=polish_free_forces&theme=migration

attributes.action: Europeans in the UK for more than 10 years should be given British citizenship.
attributes.background:
We need to demonstrate that leaving the EU will not develop xenophobic reteric in the country,which can not be controlled.
There are lots of Europeans who are keeping this country running, in the health services and caring professions who are scared they will be kicked out due to the result.

attributes.action: Reform our parliamentary system in the wake of the UK's vote for independence.
attributes.background: One argument put forward by the Leave campaign was that the EU was undemocratic. This message undoubtedly struck a chord with many voters who feel disenfranchised. Yet Brexit will not solve this since our parliamentary system remains inherently unrepresentative for the following reasons:
attributes.additional_details:
- The House of Lords is unelected.
- First Past the Post is unrepresentative. UKIP (3881129) and Greens (1157613) needed vastly more voters per MP than Labour (40290) or Conservatives (34245) (https://www.opendemocracy.net/ourkingdom/liam-anderson/voters-per-mp-why-first-past-post-failed).

The following should happen before the next election:
- The House of Lords be replaced with an elected Second Chamber.
- A debate (and possible referendum) over the best voting system (PR, STV, AV+, FPTP).

attributes.action: Guarantee a minimum extra £100m per week invested into the NHS.
attributes.background:
'Vote Leave' have successfully won the EU Referendum and we can expect the UK to start proceedings to withdraw from Europe. 

'Vote Leave' campaigned with assurances that the money we are currently handing over to the EU could be better spent on our own public services.
attributes.additional_details:
Now that 'Leave' have won this referendum they need to live up to the promises made during the campaign and guarantee that this money will be spent on public services that greatly need extra support. 

"Let's give our NHS the £350 million the EU takes every week" was a specific slogan of the 'Leave' campaign. The 'Leave' campaign website also stated "Vote Leave to invest an extra £100m into the NHS every week".

These were explicit statements made during the campaign and many people have voted on the back of such promises made. The government needs to ensure that any negotiations out of the EU also includes assurances that funds currently paid to the EU be reinvested into our public services and specifically into our underfunded NHS.

attributes.action: Refrain from triggering Article 50 until trade deals negotiated.
attributes.background: if Britain triggers Article 50 before the Government has successfully negotiated the terms of any trade treaties with the EU and all other major economies of the world it is likely to back us into a corner from which there is no return.
attributes.additional_details: Whilst Europe will want to trade with us it is not going to do so at the risk of further destabilising the EU. Trade figures clearly demonstrate that we need EU trade more than it needs ours. We will be negotiating with an EU that will have little sympathy for our position and every reason to make an example of us in order to prevent other EU member states contemplating a similar move. To invoke Article 50 before establishing the trading terms could well be political suicide.

attributes.action: David Cameron should not invoke Article 50 of the Lisbon Treaty immediately
attributes.background: The UK has voted to Leave the EU. The vote is not legally binding and UK Parliament is sovereign. David Cameron does not have to invoke article 50 of the Lisbon Treaty, giving our intention to leave the EU immediately. He should use the Leave vote as a negotiating tool and then hold a 2nd referendum

attributes.action: Ban the slaughter of all animals and sale of meat and dairy in the UK
attributes.background: The farming and slaughter of animals is barbaric and cruel. The consumption of meat and dairy is unsustainable for the planet. Large areas of land and forest are being destroyed globally. Animals are sentient beings who deserve the same rights as the humans they share the Earth with.
attributes.additional_details: http://www.livescience.com/27692-deforestation.html

attributes.action: Families should only receive benefits & tax credits for their first two children
attributes.background: Why should people be having extensive families if they cannot afford them? Why should the hard-working tax-payer have to fork out for this? Why is there not a barrier on the amount of money provided for each family?
attributes.additional_details: On 7th June on the ITV programme, This Morning a lady was speaking about her 12 children & the £40,000 of benefits that she receives each year, not only this, but her plans for her 13th child. This, alongside many other stories like this one are becoming more regular. Should it be that people having 12 children gain more money through benefits than someone working full-time? There should be a point this is restricted and the choice to have more children is at the families own expense.

attributes.action: Ban MMA and regulate the beauty industry with checks from local councils
attributes.background:
MMA causes injuries and health problems. Beauty therapists are not currently checked for accredited qualifications, insurance and hygiene.
This has led to numerous reports of injuries and litigation that could be avoided with regular checks and a formal register.

attributes.action: Ban letting agents from charging letting fees to renters.
attributes.background: Renters are hit with high costs every time they move. It is time to bring an end to expensive letting fees which are already banned in Scotland and which allow letting agents to unfairly 'double charge' both the landlord and the tenant.

attributes.action: Make food producers include corn/additives derived from corn in allergens info
attributes.background: I'm 51 with multiple food allergies. Corn allergy can cause reactions ranging from anaphylaxis to headaches and stomach problems. A list of things to avoid is 4 sheets of A4 paper long. In order to shop/eat I need to carry it with me. Life with corn allergy is difficult but could be so much easier.

attributes.action: Stop Social Services Early Intervention/unnecessary Adoption threats
attributes.background: That the Social Services are using Early Intervention even when not necessary to instigate threats of Adoption so as to meet internal quotas as set up by Ofsted and the Adoption Agencies
attributes.additional_details:
The case of Pauline Goodwin June 2005 Mother approached whilst in Hospital having just given birth, then 3 days later given court order to leave the child in the care of said hospital,.

Some critics state there are financial incentives for Local Authorities to secure adoptions, due to increased funding for social services units that effectively place a greater number of children with adopted families

attributes.action: Force County Councils to allow residents to use their closest recycling center
attributes.background: Many County Councils require proof of residency before allowing them to use their recycling centers. This forces people to travel extra distances to avoid crossing county borders to recycle. It is bad for the environment and councils should be forced to co-operate to limit this environmental damage.
attributes.additional_details: Residents of Sandhurst could travel a 6.6 mile round journey and use the Camberley recycling center. Surrey County Council are now not allowing cross county border use and as a result these residents are having to travel a 13.6 mile round journey to the Bracknell recycling center. This causes extra environmental damage and increased road use. This type of policy is in force in many areas of the country and should not be acceptable as a simple agreement between councils could stop this lunacy.

attributes.action: Postpone the EU referendum until David Cameron has negotiated an exit agreement.
attributes.background: It seems to be an unfair situation for the public to make such an important decision without truly knowing what an exit would cost. A strong leader should have negotiated terms for both staying in the EU and leaving. We will then be able to calculate the true cost of leaving or staying in the union.
attributes.additional_details: David Cameron spent only a short time negotiating with Europe about staying in the union. Another period of the same length should be spent negotiating terms for leaving the union. This might work in favour of the UK. Businesses would research all avenues for the best solution for them, this would help them make informed financial decisions. Recently the Conservative's published that £1 paid to the EU Equals £10 recieved. Maybe £0 paid will return £9, Nobody knows. Let's negotiate and find out.

attributes.action: Introduce a minimum speed limit of 100mph in the fast lane of the UK motorway.
attributes.background: Minimum speed limit of 100mph in the fast overtaking lane on UK motorways could cut down on accidents that result in serious injuries or even death.
attributes.additional_details:
Statistics show most accidents on the motorway occur in slow moving traffic.

By introducing a minimum speed limit of 100mph in the fast lane on UK motorways could cut down on accidents. This could save millions of pounds annually.

Enforcement: A speed camera that is programmed to catch out motorists driving below 100mph in the fast lane on UK motorways.

Punishment: 3 penalty points and a £100 fine or a short driving test to test their ability to see if they can drive safely at atleast 100mph in the fast lane.

attributes.action: Make it illegal to set up camp on public or private land without permission
attributes.background: In Newport gypsies set up camp with 14 caravans and an array of luxury cars including two Mercedes, a BMW X6, and a Volkswagen, blocked hundreds of NHS staff from parking outside the hospital. Hospital spokesman Ms Hayman said legal advice was sought over how to eject them.
attributes.additional_details:
Can gypsies and travellers occupy any seemingly vacant land?
No, as mentioned above, they cannot simply occupy land because it is vacant, if it has not been designated for this purpose.
Gypsies or travellers should contact the local authority in the area in which they wish to camp to find out whether there is any space for them on a permanent, or temporary site.

attributes.action: Establish a publicly owned and possibly funded film production company.
attributes.background: For 70 years The British film industry has been dominated by the American industry there are two known reason for this fact. The first being that the Americans have the advantage on distribution side  and the second being that they know they’ll receive British funding through tax relief breaks.
attributes.additional_details:
the solution is to establish a national production company which would by run by elective committee of British film makers with the purpose of producing Public service feature length films.

references

http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/entertainment-arts-34013145

http://www.theguardian.com/film/2015/feb/03/record-revenues-for-films-made-in-uk 

http://www.theguardian.com/film/video/2010/aug/28/uk-film-council-arts-funding?INTCMP=SRCH

http://screenrant.com/british-film-industry-hollywood/

attributes.action: Cap CSA payments at set weekly amount regardless of income.
attributes.background: CSA payments are currently worked out based on the ex partners income. If you're on benefits you pay £5 per week. If you're earning £36,000 per year it goes to over £100 per week for a child and continues going up with each pound earned. Cap the CSA payments to child benefit amounts!
attributes.additional_details: CSA payment calculator. Works out 15% of gross income for one child, 17% for 2 children and 19% for 3 or more children. On £36,000 per year for 3 children this is £567 per month. Leaving the payee with £1700 per month to live on. This is unfair on the payee.

attributes.action: To Make Breast Ironing a Criminal Offence
attributes.background: Ritual involves young girls having their breasts beaten, burnt and massaged in order to stop them developing.

attributes.action: Educate and enforce pornography awareness in schools
attributes.background: I believe adolescents need to be educated on how pornography can affect their emotional and physical state. Many young people are viewing it without knowledge or awareness of how it could be harming them or others.This generation have a right to know the dangers of porn addiction and abuse.
attributes.additional_details:
http://fightthenewdrug.org/

http://www.roadtograce.net/current-porn-statistics/

http://yourbrainonporn.com/physiological-and-psychological-effects-modern-day-pornography-2013

http://www.webroot.com/gb/en/home/resources/tips/digital-family-life/internet-pornography-by-the-numbers

attributes.action: Help make it illegal for kids to have Smartphones under 12 yrs old to stop abuse
attributes.background: I believe that children under the age of 12 (at least) should only be able to have phones that can make a simple telephone call or simple text (without pictures) to prevent the abuse that is a growing problem using social media.
attributes.additional_details: I read in the national papers and hear from parents of their children and the problem in keeping them off their mobile telephones, there is enormous social pressure for a smart phone for kids which is not a healthy device at early ages I believe and want support to change the law.

attributes.action: The UK Government to stop wild animal fur imports and skins into the UK.
attributes.background: Wild animals (such as leopards, tiger, crocodiles, turtles, bears and giant otters) are killed for their skin and fur to make profit.  Their skins are used for unnecessary items such as clothing, shoes, handbags and accessories. We want this to be stopped.
attributes.additional_details: We are a group of young people who are passionate about wild animals and want to stop poachers.  We had a visit recently from the Schools' Education Officer from the UK Parlimentary Office.  Previously, we have organised animal rescue club and raised money for the WWF.

attributes.action: Provide the Air Training Corps with a glider fleet fit for purpose.
attributes.background:
The Air Training Corps has operated from 1941 offering young people across the UK a wide range of opportunities and has enriched thousands of lives in the process.

The decision to vastly reduce the glider fleet will have a massively detrimental effect on the opportunities offered.
attributes.additional_details: http://www.parliament.uk/business/publications/written-questions-answers-statements/written-statement/Lords/2016-03-10/HLWS591/

attributes.action: Not to issue 12 month ban on drug driving offences with cannabis
attributes.background: Smokers who have given up smoking for a particular career can lose the opportunity of having a career if stopped and tested by the police. Each person's metabolism system is different to the next person & cannabis stays in your system for 28 days or longer.
attributes.additional_details: A person who used to smoke can be banned if cannabis is still present within their system if tested. This also leads to a loss of job which will put further pressure on a person as well as loss of finance and stability.

attributes.action: The refugee crisis distorts views on the EU. Postpone the referendum now.
attributes.background: We are in a very different place to that when the Tory referendum promise was made. The refugee crisis has deepened severely over the last year. Ignorance of all facts fuels many people's thoughts on why we should leave the EU. Time is being wasted debating this - time that should be used to help.
attributes.additional_details:
Hundreds of thousands of people heading for Europe.
European countries blockading borders.
Tear gas, water cannons and riot police used against people fleeing persecution and death.

attributes.action: Can the UK have a memorial for the 763 plus Soldiers  killed  Northern Ireland
attributes.background: Ex- Soldier who served 4 tours in NI and lost 5 good friends over there. I have seen memorials for WW1 WW2, The Falklands war and today the unveiling of one for the first Gulf War. It is as if we are being ignored.
